verses.kjv: Then Joseph could not refrain himself before all them that stood by him; and he cried, Cause every man to go out from me. And there stood no man with him, while Joseph made himself known unto his brethren.
verses.ct: Joseph couldn't hold back his emotions any longer in front of everyone standing around him. He shouted, "Everyone leave my presence!" So no one else was there when Joseph revealed who he was to his brothers.

verses.kjv: And he wept aloud: and the Egyptians and the house of Pharaoh heard.
verses.ct: He cried so loudly that the Egyptians heard it, and word reached Pharaoh's household.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I am Joseph; doth my father yet live? And his brethren could not answer him; for they were troubled at his presence.
verses.ct: Joseph said to his brothers, "I'm Joseph! Is my father still alive?" But his brothers were unable to respond because they were completely stunned to be standing in front of him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his brethren, Come near to me, I pray you. And they came near. And he said, I am Joseph your brother, whom ye sold into Egypt.
verses.ct: Joseph said to his brothers, "Please, come closer to me." They stepped forward. Then he said, "I am your brother Joseph — the one you sold into Egypt."

verses.kjv: Now therefore be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me hither: for God did send me before you to preserve life.
verses.ct: "But don't be upset or blame yourselves for selling me here, because God sent me ahead of you to save lives."

verses.kjv: For these two years hath the famine been in the land: and yet there are five years, in the which there shall neither be earing nor harvest.
verses.ct: "The famine has been in the land for 2 years now, and there are still 5 more years when no one will be able to plow or harvest."

verses.kjv: And God sent me before you to preserve you a posterity in the earth, and to save your lives by a great deliverance.
verses.ct: "God sent me ahead of you to ensure your survival on the earth and to rescue your lives through an incredible act of deliverance."

verses.kjv: So now it was not you that sent me hither, but God: and he hath made me a father to Pharaoh, and lord of all his house, and a ruler throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: "So it wasn't really you who sent me here — it was God. He has made me like a father to Pharaoh, master over his entire household, and ruler of all the land of Egypt."

verses.kjv: Haste ye, and go up to my father, and say unto him, Thus saith thy son Joseph, God hath made me lord of all Egypt: come down unto me, tarry not:
verses.ct: "Hurry back to my father and tell him, 'This is what your son Joseph says: God has made me ruler over all of Egypt. Come down to me without delay."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt dwell in the land of Goshen, and thou shalt be near unto me, thou, and thy children, and thy children’s children, and thy flocks, and thy herds, and all that thou hast:
verses.ct: "You will settle in the region of Goshen, where you'll be close to me — you, your children, your grandchildren, your flocks, your herds, and everything you own."

verses.kjv: And there will I nourish thee; for yet there are five years of famine; lest thou, and thy household, and all that thou hast, come to poverty.
verses.ct: "I will provide for you there, because 5 years of famine still remain. Otherwise you, your household, and everything you have will end up in poverty.'"

verses.kjv: And, behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin, that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you.
verses.ct: "You can see for yourselves — and my brother Benjamin can see too — that it's really me speaking directly to you."

verses.kjv: And ye shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all that ye have seen; and ye shall haste and bring down my father hither.
verses.ct: "Tell my father about all the honor I have in Egypt and everything you've witnessed. Then hurry and bring my father down here."

verses.kjv: And he fell upon his brother Benjamin’s neck, and wept; and Benjamin wept upon his neck.
verses.ct: Then he threw his arms around his brother Benjamin and cried, and Benjamin threw his arms around him and cried too.

verses.kjv: Moreover he kissed all his brethren, and wept upon them: and after that his brethren talked with him.
verses.ct: He also kissed each of his brothers and wept over them. After that, his brothers were finally able to talk with him.

verses.kjv: And the fame thereof was heard in Pharaoh’s house, saying, Joseph’s brethren are come: and it pleased Pharaoh well, and his servants.
verses.ct: When the news reached Pharaoh's palace that Joseph's brothers had arrived, Pharaoh and his officials were pleased.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Say unto thy brethren, This do ye; lade your beasts, and go, get you unto the land of Canaan;
verses.ct: Pharaoh told Joseph, "Say to your brothers, 'Here's what to do: load up your animals and head back to the land of Canaan.

verses.kjv: And take your father and your households, and come unto me: and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and ye shall eat the fat of the land.
verses.ct: Then get your father and your families and come back to me. I will give you the best that the land of Egypt has to offer, and you will enjoy the richest food in the land.'"

verses.kjv: Now thou art commanded, this do ye; take you wagons out of the land of Egypt for your little ones, and for your wives, and bring your father, and come.
verses.ct: "You are also instructed to do this: take carts from Egypt for your young children and your wives, and bring your father back here.

verses.kjv: Also regard not your stuff; for the good of all the land of Egypt is yours.
verses.ct: Don't worry about leaving your belongings behind, because the best of everything in Egypt will be yours."

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did so: and Joseph gave them wagons, according to the commandment of Pharaoh, and gave them provision for the way.
verses.ct: The sons of Israel did as instructed. Joseph provided them with carts, just as Pharaoh had ordered, and gave them supplies for the journey.

verses.kjv: To all of them he gave each man changes of raiment; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver, and five changes of raiment.
verses.ct: He gave each of them a set of new clothing, but to Benjamin he gave 300 pieces of silver and 5 sets of clothing.

verses.kjv: And to his father he sent after this manner; ten asses laden with the good things of Egypt, and ten she asses laden with corn and bread and meat for his father by the way.
verses.ct: To his father he sent the following: 10 donkeys loaded with the finest products of Egypt, and 10 female donkeys loaded with grain, bread, and other food for his father's journey.

verses.kjv: So he sent his brethren away, and they departed: and he said unto them, See that ye fall not out by the way.
verses.ct: Then he sent his brothers on their way. As they left, he told them, "Don't argue with each other along the road!"

verses.kjv: And they went up out of Egypt, and came into the land of Canaan unto Jacob their father,
verses.ct: They traveled up from Egypt and arrived in the land of Canaan, back to their father Jacob.

verses.kjv: And told him, saying, Joseph is yet alive, and he is governor over all the land of Egypt. And Jacob’s heart fainted, for he believed them not.
verses.ct: They told him, "Joseph is still alive! In fact, he's the ruler over all of Egypt!" Jacob was stunned — he couldn't believe what they were saying.

verses.kjv: And they told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said unto them: and when he saw the wagons which Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of Jacob their father revived:
verses.ct: But when they repeated everything Joseph had told them, and when he saw the carts that Joseph had sent to transport him, their father Jacob's spirit came back to life.

verses.kjv: And Israel said, It is enough; Joseph my son is yet alive: I will go and see him before I die.
verses.ct: Israel said, "That's all I need to hear! My son Joseph is still alive. I will go and see him before I die."
